did.abstract: The Barke mss., 1948, consists of three volumes of The Wonder of All the Gay World: A Novel of the Life and Loves of Robert Burns by author James Barke, 1905-1958.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.
Many collections are housed offsite; retrieval requires advance notice. Please make an appointment a minimum of one week in advance of your visit.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Photography and digitization may be restricted for some collections. Copyright restrictions may apply. Before publishing, researchers are responsible for securing permission from all applicable rights holders, then filling out the Permission to Publish form.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: James Barke was born in 1905 in Selkirkshire, Scotland. He moved to Glasgow as a young man and became actively involved in Nationalistic politics. He eventually became a writer and is now best known for his six-volume work concerning the life and accomplishments of poet Robert Burns, entitled collectively as Immortal Memory. Barke died in 1958.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Barke mss., 1948, consists of three volumes of The Wonder of All the Gay World: A Novel of the Life and Loves of Robert Burns by author James Barke, 1905-1958.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged following original order.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Barke mss., Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana.
